title: Should we change the price of the first BOB from 1 ETH to 0.1 ETH?
body:
Context:

[Hakt DAO membership tokens (BOBs)](https://hakt.notion.site/BOBs-Hakt-DAO-Membership-Tokens-c5fc20831fdb404db5d2adfa1dfc1d7f) are currently sold on a bonding curve, with the first BOB priced at 1 ETH and every subsequent priced at 1.1% more ETH than the last. We did this to discourage bots and short term NFT traders from buying into the project and to filter for community members who are more aligned with the long term success and mission of Hakt DAO. However, after many discussions with developers, hackers, contract security experts, and investors, it seems that an initial price of 1 ETH is too steep and an unnecessarily high barrier to entry.

Proposal:

I am proposing we change the price of the first BOB from 1 ETH to 0.1 ETH. The bonding curve (1.1%) will remain the same. Those who minted at the original 1 ETH price will retain their BOB and be refunded in ETH for the difference they paid (original minting price - new minting price).

Reasoning:

I believe the community element of Hakt DAO is vital to its success. Making this change in price will likely allow many more people to join us. 0.1 ETH is also not immaterial, and with the bonding curve should still be an effective "quality filter".
